To start using Arm Development Studio 2024.0 either: - Create a suite sub-shell using /opt/arm/developmentstudio-2024.0/bin/suite_exec <shell> - Launch GUI tools via their desktop menu entries The Release notes for the product can be found here: file:///opt/arm/developmentstudio-2024.0/sw/info/readme.html VOFA+ #Download the software directly from on official website.
VOFA+ After installation, double-clicking the software icon does not start the program normally. Run it in terminal, it would repot the error:
vofa+: error while loading shared libraries: libcrypto.so.1.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Before UBUNTU22.04, we may can install it directly
sudo apt install libssl1.1 After 22.04, we can’t find the package because libssl1.1 may have been replaced by libssl3.
Luckily, I found libssl1.1 in my system:
find / -name "libcrypto.so*" # OUTPUT: /opt/QQ/resources/app/avsdk/libcrypto.so.1.1 So we can make symbolic link:
sudo ln -s /opt/QQ/resources/app/avsdk/libcrypto.so.1.1 /usr/lib/libcrypto.so.1.1 If we can’t find libssl1.1, we can download QQ-linux or download it manually (for reference only).

ip -details link show can0 ä¸‰ã€ä½¿ç”¨Python-canåº“ #import can import time import threading # è®¾ç½®CANæ¥å£çš„é…ç½® can0_config = { 'interface': 'socketcan', 'channel': 'can0', 'bitrate': 500000 } can1_config = { 'interface': 'socketcan', 'channel': 'can1', 'bitrate': 500000 } # å®šä¹‰è¦å‘é€çš„æ¶ˆæ¯ messages = [ "Hello from CAN0!", "Greetings from CAN1!", "CAN is fun!", "Let's communicate!" ] def can_sender(bus, msg_id, message): data = [ord(c) for c in message] # å°†å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå­—èŠ‚æ•°ç»„ msg = can.Message(arbitration_id=msg_id, data=data[:8], is_extended_id=False) try: bus.send(msg) print(f"Message sent on {bus.channel_info}: ID={msg_id} Data={message}") except can.CanError: print("Message NOT sent") def can_receiver(bus): while True: msg = bus.recv() if msg: received_message = ''.join(chr(byte) for byte in msg.data) print(f"Message received on {bus.channel_info}: {received_message}") def main(): # åˆ›å»ºCANæ€»çº¿å¯¹è±¡ can0 = can.Bus(**can0_config) can1 = can.Bus(**can1_config) # å¯åŠ¨æ¥æ”¶çº¿ç¨‹ receiver_thread_0 = threading.Thread(target=can_receiver, args=(can0,)) receiver_thread_1 = threading.Thread(target=can_receiver, args=(can1,)) receiver_thread_0.start() receiver_thread_1.start() # å‘é€æ¶ˆæ¯ for message in messages: can_sender(can0, 0x100, message) time.sleep(1) # ä¼‘æ¯ä¸€æ®µæ—¶é—´ä»¥é¿å…å‘é€å†²çª can_sender(can1, 0x200, message) time.sleep(1) # å…è®¸ä¸€äº›æ—¶é—´æ¥æ¥æ”¶æ¶ˆæ¯ time.sleep(5) # å…³é—­CANæ€»çº¿ can0.shutdown() can1.shutdown() return if __name__ == "__main__": main() å››ã€å…³é—­è®¾å¤‡ # sudo ip link set can0 down sudo ip link set can1 down links #Updater - CANable
